page.title: 12BELLE VUE PARK - LOWESTOFT
page.content: The entrance to Belle Vue Park is from the Ravine. It is a park and gardens joined to the Sparrows Nest. At the top of the gardens is a war memorial surrounded by three cannons. The memorial is the Lowestoft Naval Memorial. The names are arranged according to year of death and rank. The memorial was built, and is maintained, by the Commonwealth War Graves Commission. There are approximately 2,584 men's names on the memorial who were lost at sea and who have no graves. There is also a slab on the floor which has 37 names on and they are people who died on the land. The Iron Bridge that is in the park was presented by William Youngman, 1st. Mmayor of Lowestoft, to commemorate the jubilee of the reign of Queen Victoria.
